--- title: Categorical Data Analysis subtitle: template description: | template categories: - template author: Kwangmin Kim date: 03/17/2023 format: html: page-layout: full code-fold: true toc: true number-sections: true execute: include: false warning: false message: false draft: False ---
    • ::: {#Korean .tab-pane .fade .show .active role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="Korean-tab"} ## Goal * Visualization Methods * for EDA: visualize patterns, trends, anomalies in data * for model diagnostic methods: visualize to assess violations of assumptions * for summary methods: visualize to provide an interpretable summary of data * apply theory to practice * conert research questions into statistical hypotheses and models * look into the difference between non-parametric (ex. fisher exact test) vs parametric (ex. $\chi^2 test for independence$) vs model-based methods (ex. logistic regression) * for summary methods: visualize to provide an interpretable summary of data ## Definition of Categorical Data * categorical (or frequency) data consist of a discrete set of categories, which may be ordered or unordered. * unordered * gener: {male, female, transgender} * marital status: {never married, married, separated, divorced, widowed} * party preference: {NDP, liberal, conservative, green} * treatment improvement: {none, some, marked} * ordered * age group: {0s,10s,20s,30s, ...} * number of children: {0, 1 , 2 ,3, ...} ## Structures Categorical data appears in various forms like: * tables * one way * two way * three way * matrices * array * data frames * case form * frequency form * :::
    ::: {#English .tab-pane .fade role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="English-tab"} :::
